column4: New to Ubuntu Linux, want to know how to get an app to launch at startup. (sudo & gksudo does not work)
you mean after login to gnome desktop?
greets to all
New to Ubuntu Linux, want to know how to get an app to launch at startup. (sudo & gksudo does not work)
select System | Preferences | Sessions | Startup Programs
Doesn't work in the sessions
Launch form the teminal works
what is it you're running?
firestarter
anarrgh
firestarter is a frontend to iptables, iptables runs automatically
so how do I get the thing to start at system login
ps -A doesn't list it unless I start it
the frirewall will function without firestarter being open
OK does that mean it is running though it isn't listed in ps?
iptables is part of the kernel, I do believe
see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/IptablesHowTo
Well thats good news thought discomforting that I can't verify its existance.
Thanks for the help. Will check the link. :)
that web page tells you how to verify
Thanks again. Will be back again in the futer I'm sure. Unix made easy doesn't quite cut it. LOL
sometimes it's a matter of unlearning :)
